EmailTemplate.description: This template should be used when a change request is received. It requests additional details about the change which will assist the team with proper sizing and approval.
EmailTemplate.name: Change Request Information
EmailTemplate.subject: CASE#: {!Case.CaseNumber} More Information Needed
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {!Receiving_User.FirstName},
To assist IT in understanding the business issue and criticality of your request, please fill out this Business Requirements Document.
Consideration for your request will be dependent upon the thoroughness of the information you provide. If your request is approved, it will be prioritized along with other approved feature requests.
Requester Information:
Requester Name: Requester Email: Date Prepared: Case Number and Short Summary: {!Case.CaseNumber} {!Case.Description}
Business Owner(s) of the Business Process:
Contact Name: Contact Email: Role of Contact:
Business Tester(s) of the Change Request:
Tester Name: Tester Email: Backup Tester Name: Backup Tester Email: Role of Contacts:
Change Request Approver:
Approver Name: Approver Email: Backup Approver Name: Backup Approver Email: Role of Contacts:
Please select the priority of your request:
A) Business critical; affects business operations today with no workaround. B) Generates ROI for the BU C) Nice-to-have feature request D) Important but can be completed when resources are available:
Enhancement Request / Business Justification:
What is the current business process? (Please include the current steps followed â€“ who does what, when, where, why and how? Please include any other relevant documentation i.e., screenshots, web links, process documents, reports, or email correspondence.)
What is the business issue that you are trying to solve? (Please include the proposed new business process.)
What is the impact of this issue on our customers today? (Customer can be internal)
What functions(s) and/or BU(s) are impacted by this issue? How long has this been an issue?
What are you doing today as a workaround for this issue?
Are there any critical time dependencies or data conversion items that need to be considered?
Any additional information?
